intro: Piptocarpha sexangularis, commonly known as the angular glassworts, is a species of flowering plant in the family Amaranthaceae. It is native to arid and semi-arid regions of southern Africa, particularly Namibia and South Africa. The plant is characterized by its succulent, fleshy stems and leaves, which are adapted to store water and withstand drought conditions. It produces small, greenish flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences, often appearing in late spring to early summer. Piptocarpha sexangularis is typically found in rocky outcrops, sandy soils, and other dry habitats where it thrives with minimal water availability.
